Subject: No access to server console after setting FQDN
Description: Lost console access to Endpoint Protector server after setting FQDN in Server Certificate Stack per https://www.endpointprotector.com/support/endpoint-protector/how-to-set-fqdn-in-subject - not able to SSH using root either. Cannot open console by IP or FQDN - connection refused. This is not in production yet
What_We_Know__c:
1 May '25 - the customer set server certificate stack and regenerated the certificate. the action caused a loss of access to the console.
the IP change did not regenerate the certificate to default, so I reached out to devops.

2 May '25 - devops did not provide a solution, but in my tests I managed to restore a backup, but it was not needed anymore since the customer has a snapshot and will revert
Next_Steps__c: waiting for the customer to restore the appliance and then help him set up what he needs regarding certs next week
Solution_Comment__c: Redeployed the appliance and everything works as intended.
